in the future can be a ROS service initialized by the task manager
Member ObservationAgent::action_to_obs_Map (hrc_ros::InformHumanAction::Request &req, hrc_ros::InformHumanAction::Response &res)
(HAR system to be integrated to here) Normally the human observations shouldnt come from the human agent itself. It is sort of human is informing the action taken directly back to the system. Ideal would be to detect the human actions through actual observation process (e.g. input from a camera) and should be processed here to recognize.
Member ObservationAgent::getRealRbtStPOMDP (string humanState)
The detection of human needs help is mapped completely rule based which may not be the case. So, in real user studies this sort of mapping is useless. Even in the simulation since the human model does not have a direct state of 'human needs help' so understanding it is manually implemented for now.
